intro: Rondeletia heteranthera, commonly known as the Brazilian flame flower, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairy and have a rough texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Rondeletia heteranthera is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
